funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.io

Class WaveInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.io.WaveInputStream
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidWaveInputStream, MSWAVEInputStream, RAWWaveInputStream

    public abstract class WaveInputStream
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is the superclass of all classes representing an audio input stream.

    Any object that is a subclass of InputStream must always provide methods that return the next byte of input, the next sample of input, and the WaveFormat in use. Additionally, subclasses must implement a method to close the underlying stream.

    See Also:
    AndroidWaveInputStream, MSWAVEInputStream

      Reads floats of audio data from the input stream up to the length of the buffer

      Reads floats of audio data from the input stream up to the length of the buffer
      abstract float readSample()

      • read

        public abstract byte read()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next byte from the input stream and returns it, or returns -1 if a byte could not be read
        Returns:
        the next sample value in the stream or -2
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs on the stream

      • readSample

        public abstract float readSample()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next sample(float) from the input stream and returns it, or returns -2 if a sample could not be read. If the stream contains multi-channel audio, the next sample from each channel is read, and the average is returned.
        Returns:
        the next sample value in the stream or -2
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs on the stream

      • read

        public int read(float[] f)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads floats of audio data from the input stream up to the length of the buffer
        Parameters:
        f - the byte buffer array to which data is read
        Returns:
        the number of bytes successfully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs on the stream

      • read

        public int read(float[] f,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads floats of audio data from the input stream up to the length of the buffer
        Parameters:
        f - the byte buffer array to which data is read
        off - location to begin writing to the array
        len - how many bytes to read (len > (b.length-off) ? len = b.length-off)
        Returns:
        the number of bytes successfully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs on the stream
